description: An illustration of an antique-style wall-mounted telephone: the body of the telephone is made of brown wood, with a black bell-shaped receiver hanging on the left side of the telephone, a black speaking piece extending outwards from the front of the telephone, and two golden bells above the speaking piece. There is a small wooden shelf below the speaking piece and a black rod-shaped handle on the right side of the telephone.

author.name: VertexArchive
author.description: An UNOFFICIAL archive of the New York Times' Vertex puzzle. This account is not affiliated with the NY Times. I just like the triangles.
